description: Awesome customer service. We went there not knowing what we wanted and Chris helped us choose and we went with caramel iced blend. They also added coconut whipcream to make it even better. And to add to all of this, they gave us 2 fruity drinks that someone ordered but never picked up. Thank you Peets coffee and the team at this location, you guys made our day even more special.
author: Atieh G.

description:
Really sad to write a negative review but I seem to be in good company noticing this location has deteriorated. The javivas were the first to go, they come out syrupy sweet and liquid - no icy body like I get from other locations and prefer.
Last visit with coworkers one was charged for soymilk, told by the person making her coffee that was incorrect, then put through a ten minute long process for some sort of compensation for approximately 60 cents. While that's happening, several other drinks are made before my no frills small nonfat latte. When they finally call my name it's a medium. I ordered a small for a reason. Giving me a bunch of extra milk calories is not an appropriate compensation for making all three of us late back to work.
Today I watched in disbelief while my no frills small nonfat latte cup appeared to be pumped with chocolate syrup I didn't order. To top it off, the coffee is so unbelievably hot that I scalded my mouth trying to figure out if my eyes had deceived me on the chocolate and still cant drink it ten minutes later back at my desk.
I'm tired of not trusting the staff here to get it right, and they all seem frazzled and simultaneously sluggish, and even the sparkling employee I've known for the last two years seems downtrodden and lacking in his normal joviality. Whatever is wrong here -new management or corporate changes or just bad hiring - please address it, you guys used to be great.
author: Leslie C.

description: I felt like I needed a visitor's pass here.  I walked up to the counter to order my latte.  I'm the only one in line.  No greeting of any kind.  I placed my order using my app.  Finally the barista spoke up by saying my name.  Then he began a dialogue by asking me what I'm planning to do.  Later a couple of regulars came through. The entire crew chatted up a storm.  Plus as I'm waiting for my latte there's a bunch of idle chatter by the other two baristas.
author: Shirley N.

description: Ugh what happened to the superior staff here?  They quit?  There are a few new faces here and usually I don't mind as long as they know how to make a good coffee.  However, today I ordered a Havana Cappucino and they gave me a cup of foam.  The foam disintegrated by the time I got back to the office and I'm left with half a cup of coffee.  Seriously Peets?  The coffee is about $5 and you can't even give me 3/4 full?  WTF!  So disappointed.
author: Wendy H.

description:
I am usually quite content with the Peet's location at 601 Van Ness but I noticed something recently that someone else pointed out in the reviews. I did not receive the same friendly, bubbly greeting that 'regular' customers receive. The person who took my order seemed bored, even impatient with me as I ordered. I completed my order (simple, no special requests, just a mocha and a pastry). I checked-in using the Peet's app. For the very next person the cashier was super friendly and animated, calling the person by name before they even got to the counter. I don't expect to be treated like the cashier's best friend, but at least be nice and don't be so obvious about your preference for 'regulars'.

Next, I ordered a ham and swiss croissant. I took it to my office to eat and found a piece of plastic bag (approx 1/2 in x 1/2 in) inside the croissant. I'm pretty sure that Peet's does not bake onsite so it's the fault of the supplier/bakery. I'm just glad I found the plastic and didn't swallow it.
author: Buster D.

description:
I would call myself a regular here. I have been coming to this store for the past few years almost every morning. But the more I come here, the more I feel unwelcome. For many times already ... and especially this morning ... I don't get a lid on my brewed coffee anymore. He past me the coffee and just turn around and walked away ... 

... time to move on to other coffee shops ...
author: Kevin L.

description:
Huge line to counter and slimy employee wouldn't let me use the bathroom before buying a drink despite letting him know i was gonna get in line but HAD to pee.
depsite buying a coffee FROM HIM every morning for 3 weeks while at work. 
He hogged it for 20 minutes then seemed excited to come out and slam the door to demand i bought something to get a weird paper key before i was allowed to pee.
 He has been especially weird to me every morning since he saw me wearing an "act up" shirt so he may just be a homophobe exercising the little power he holds to be needlessly aggressive. Finally had an excuse to be more than passively rude to me. New "electronic bathroom app" thing is so ham-handed and dehumanizing. 
This place is maybe homophobic. Definitely gross.
author: Io O.

description:
Great location situated just steps away from the War Memorial Opera House. 

This is a nice spot to have a cup of coffee before or after a show (granted that you're not wearing your ball gown at the time : )

It's also a good meeting spot if you're waiting for friends before heading to one of the restaurants located nearby on Van Ness.

Spacious enough that you can find seating anywhere, as I've never found it to be packed like other coffee houses.

The baristas and cashiers have also always been friendly and nice whenever I've stopped in.
author: Diana V.

description:
You know you're a regular when the staff recognizes you

Barista: Hey, where have you been!?
Me: Umm, I've been trying to cut back on coffee....?
Barista: You're lying, I can see it in your eyes

That feeling of guilt when you've been caught...

The staff are always friendly and the drinks are good.  My favorite barista hooked me up with some tropical tea, how exotic!  There's usually a line but it goes by quick.
author: Linda N.

description:
Best thing? Opens at 6am on weekdays! Philz coffee is across the street and opens early too, but I chose Peets because it has seating! Great place to do some work in the morning


Order: 

Havana cappuccino: frothy, hot, pretty standard

butter croissant: 4.5", warmed up for you, standard
author: Vivian C.

description:
Books and coffee, a time-tested combination. That's why when I heard about this Books, Inc./Peets combo, I decided to visit. When I first arrived, I noticed the shattered glass door on the Peets-side of the building; it was haphazardly covered with masking tape. I decided to visit the bookstore first, perhaps to get a fresh start and experience the walkway between the two.

After browsing the store for a minute, I made my way to Peets through the connecting walkway, which curiously had chairs and tables placed in it. I scooted by an additional clutter of chairs and tables at the entrance as I made my way to the counter. I stood within the unnecessary TSA-style line control barrier and waited to order. Curiously, the vast space dedicated to ordering drinks dwarfed the clutter of work space shoved next to the entrance. I finally got my coffee (which was fine) and went back to the entrance area to sit down. 

The glare of the tall building across the street obscured my view, but perhaps it was a good thing to not stare directly at the space around me. I suddenly felt ill by the decor, which was a persistent theme of dark brown, framed by light brown--the walls, the counter, the tables, everything seems to have this theme. As a bonus, the table's granite-like top matched the counter's. My table was positioned right next to the restroom, so I had the pleasure of hearing the toilet flush and the loud jet-engine powered hand-dryer go off a dozen or so times during my visit. This was paired with the cranky and clunky sounds of coffee machinery in the back. 

It was time to leave. I carefully placed my empty coffee cup on top of the overflowing trash can, stepped over a dirty brown mat, and carefully opened the broken glass door to avoid any shards of glass. I survived.

This wasn't the best experience, but hey, maybe it's because i'm not a big fan of Peets.
author: Behnam S.

description: Don't ask to use the bathroom here. They use a high tech system where u have to scan a paper bar code to gain entry. I asked to use the restroom first to a non cashier who said she was too busy to give me a paper scan code. I then stood in front of her for over a minute waiting for a cashier who then told me I needed to buy something first. I then explained that I don't want to bring my food into the restroom I will order after. He gives me a paper code then I discover that at 9 am they have no seat covers or toilet paper. I inform them of this and a light skinned shorter woman who says she is the manager says yeah we gotta go to Walgreens. Ok so why not convey that to your employees and I wouldn't have been wasting my time standing there and the first employee could have told me it's out of order? Now I'm waiting in line for coffee and I see her bring toilet paper from the back? She sees me in line and says nothing. Ok I order my coffee and sandwich and get issued another scan code. Now while I am using the restroom the door opens automatically. I mean alllllll the way open because it is computerized. I walk out after and explain to her what happened. No sorry for our computer error or anything just a blank stare and ok. I see that the employees are nice to each other but extremely inconvenienced by a customer asking anything. Had the same observation yesterday. I'll go back to Philz tomorrow. At 9 am your bathroom should be stocked and clean not filthy and empty from all paper products ESPECIALLY if your monitoring the usage with your failing scan entry system.
author: Lorain C.

description:
If you're in a bind and you need to grab something to drink & eat before going to a meeting in the area, a film at Opera Plaza or a reading at Books Inc, pop into Peets Coffee store. They carry food now that can tide you over until you have a sit down meal. 
There are sandwiches, orzo/lentil salad containers, a cheese & fruit tray, boiled eggs, yogurt parfaits --easy peasy to pick up.
Taste: s'okay...not bad. But it would be nice if the sandwich could be heated or the salads packaged with a little more flair. Anyways, it gets the job done when you're hungry and sweets just won't do.
Just so you know...
author: Joanna T.

description:
2 people working here so far have had major major attitude.
The girl today Tuesday 1-23-18 1:30pm..complete bitch.
Place seems to hire new faces all the time rather than explain to the children what respect and service is.  So must be the owners fault.
If their unhappy with their lives there is always the Golden Gate Bridge.
Wait till the sharks come by for feeding about 8pm.  Your off work then right?  No one wants to see the cry babies behind the counter wearing their little name tags.  Make it a party!  Drink your coffee on the way down.  Product Placement!
author: John D.

description: never order the iced chai tea latte, it is nothing like the good starbucks one. tasted so bad i had the throw the whole thing away.
author: Roxanne E.

description: The staff here are awesome. They are super friendly and welcoming and make this a great neighborhood spot. Plus Peet's has great coffee and the new hot breakfast sandwiches are good and a good deal. And there's always the bagel w cream cheese for $2 which is tough to beat!
author: Matt H.

description: Peet's coffee on Monday morning is a must! This coffee gets me started to a great productive morning. Bolder in taste than its big competition Starbucks . Morning , noon and evening Peet's will jolt me with caffeine that is much needed.
author: Michael G.

description: Worst service ever.  If your bathroom is out of order, then put a sign on the door so I can become patrent of Philz next door and use their facilities.
author: Jo L.

description:
Love the hustle and bustle of this Peet's.

No matter how busy they are, the staff are always calm, take your order with a smile, and are quick to get you your order.

Thanks! :)
author: Shereen A.

description:
Conveniently near where I work! I like coming here for a quick breakfast item and a hot drink. Aside from coffee, I also like ordering their apple cider, which isn't overly sweet and has a hint of cinnamon. Their iced teas are also yummy and fruity, although those are way sweeter. Good for hot summer days!

I've tried several of their pastries, such as bagels, croissants, and cinnamon twists. They're a bit plain and can be kinda stale, even when warmed up, but they're decent for a cheap breakfast.

They're usually busy in the morning and the place can be packed. The few times that I've went, the line gets taken care of pretty quickly. The cashiers are friendly and efficient at their job, and the baristas are quick at making drinks.
author: Vivian L.

description:
I've stopped by here in two visits.

Pros: Exceptional customer service (Extra star for that)! I've had a short conversation with an elderly lady that stopped by there for coffee, and they treated her exceptionally well. (Particular day --- July 15, 2016 (Around 3-5:30pm))

Cons: A few food/drink items to work on.....

- The morning menu, particularly the spinach/feta cheese item, was not worth it's value. I paid 4.84 (includes tax) for a flat looking, kid sized, pita-bread thing! Come on now.... I could've went to Subway for a fuller looking meal!

-  I haven't yet tried their lattes or house coffee, but their iced Javiva mocha coffees need a bit more of work. Lack of coffee flavor, very flat taste, and tastes very watered down.  Maybe it's towards the end of the day (5:30), but their drinks still need to be top quality!!!! There is a drastic difference of quality between Pete's and Starbuck's Frapp's. They really can't beat their competitior at this rate.
author: Angela L.

description:
I'm generally not a big fan of Peet's coffee since their espresso always has a hot brewed coffee taste. But this place wins me over by their friendly service, incredible location, and spacious, clean seating area. None other Peet's location exhibits the same quality except the one in Fillmore at, which is currently under renovation. I love how it's situated right next to the bookstore. What goes better with coffee than books? 

I would love to give it five stars if only the wifi can be more stable and sturdy. It's frustrating that it takes about 10 mins to send an email. No kidding. Anyway, come over for a morning coffee, this place will totally gets rid of your Monday blue!
author: Claire Y.

description: i just got to say, these guys are great... i get in line and the barista's are already making my cup of joe..  actually cup of Mocha....  They all know just how i like it and it is that way everytime.... love these guys.  Although they are right across the street from Philz, there is no comparison.  Way to go Denzel... (Rolando)
author: George J.

description:
Consistently providing great customer service and coffee!

I've had to be around this location for the past few weeks and this is the most convenient coffee shop for me to stop by. Although parking can be a little hard to find during the work week, I am usually lucky and can snag a spot right around the corner. 

My normal go to drinks are a caramel cafe latte and iced white chocolate mochas..always spot on! They have some new coconut drinks that I have tried (and loved), the coconut creme latte and the coconut creme javiva, great treat for a warm afternoon...or any time really.
I recently tried the Havana cappuccino and I am in love! Rich cappucccino with warm cinnamon! Reminds me somewhat of a Mexican hot chocolate.
I normally reach for sweet, rich drinks but even a basic cup of hot, bold coffee is always great from this spot.
author: Danielle R.

description:
I was walking to work and saw the advertisement for the new Milk Chocolate Almond Mocha drink. I was down to try it based on the description alone. 

So, in I go--short line and a nice gentleman behind the counter ready to take my order. They had two different speciality drinks: the one listed above and a toffee drink. I asked him which one he recommends. He suggested the chocolate almond mocha, so I opted for that.  He was very nice.

I paid and picked up my drink in less than 3 minutes. I took a sip and surprised at how rich and true-to-taste it was. I mean you can really taste the chocolate and almond flavors! This drink tastes amazing, so if you haven't tried it, go and try today!

All in all, I always have a great experience at peets! Thanks guys!
author: Sylvia O.

description: The staff.... ahhhhhhmazing! Excellent customer service!
author: Liz J.

description:
This is my favorite Peets that helps me get through each day of work! The employees are ALWAYS friendly and welcome you with a smile or ask how you have been. 

The pastries are always fresh & delicious. I highly recommend the gingerbread, blueberry muffin or pumpkin bread! I always get the caramel latte or seasonal pumpkin latte.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
I've been coming here for the past three years and I can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet. 

The staff is really friendly, especially Jon who always has a smile on his face. Most of the baristas know how to make a tasty cup of coffee. There have been times when they fell short, but it's usually with the newbies. After some experience, they get it right. 

It can get really crowded, especially on Friday mornings. But it's difficult to be impatient because service is quick.

Be sure to check in on Yelp for discounts on their seasonal items!
author: Vira P.

description:
Service is ok until you send a drink back.  Be cautious...your barista will be disgruntled, unapologetic, and put fault on your taste.  Staff is unhappy to be here.  Their morale need boosting!

My only complaint is with their specialty beverages.  I'm certain there's a standard formula to making these drinks but there's definitely a lack of care/consistency.   Everything has been awful lately!!!  I come here 3-4 times a week.  And for $5 a drink...it's not ok to get crap coffee/service.  Nothing tastes like it should be.  It's either watered down, too milky, too strong (two shots instead of one), no vanilla or mocha flavor, or odd flavors etc.  I swear only Ben and the tall blonde (I apologize for not knowing your name) know how to do it right.  Unfortunately, they are hardly ever seen behind the counter.

Please please retrain your staff on how to brew beverages the right way.  Until then, Philz it is.
author: amee m.

description:
Couldn't check in cause this place wasn't in yelp yet.

Baristas were really nice and helpful.

Ordered the hazelnut cinnamon (seasonal) and it was perfect. Not too sweet and didn't take like crap.
author: Kenneth C.

description:
I called this Peet's (since it is the closest one to my job) to see if I can purchase a $5 gift card with a gift card that I already have in my wallet.  The answer from the male barista is: yes!  

Not knowing what to expect because I have never been into this Peet's, I was most certainly surprised by a random act of kindness from Seanna who handled my transaction.  Too often random acts of kindness do not get mentioned and/or recognized.  

Besides getting the $5 gift card (leaving me with a balance of $11.45 on my own gift card), I asked for a large Hibiscus breeze, which I was willing pay for it.  Instead, Seanna told me "it was on the house".  I couldn't believe it...wow...that was totally cool.  I never had that type of treatment from the other coffee business (the one that has the venti caramel frappuccino).  

All I can say is a big thank you to Seanna for being awesome and wonderful.  You're kindness will always shine in my eyes.
author: Carol C.

description: This place use to be my coffee spot every morning and evening because the employees and managers use to be awesome , and the service was GREAT. By mistake today i stopped by wishing that the service improved but unfortunately i ve had to deal with JOEL i ve said good morning 3 times and he was making fun of me , i will NEVER EVER come back and i will never stop by peet s coffee no more. Thanks god starbucks coffee and employees are GREAT.
author: Mickael E.

description:
when I am need to put the coffee in my body
I go here and order Ice America no.
Taste good seriously.
author: Max K.

description: I kid you not but I come to this location almost everyday since its conveniently located by my apartment. Triple shot lattes is all I ever get and can't get enough of. Just one sip of coffee touches my soul. I must say Peets has the best coffee beans. The richness, bold, tasty flavor and aroma keeps me coming back or I might just be a caffeine addict. See you guys tomorrow.
author: Sonia R.

description:
Stopped by while in the bookstore next door. Didn't really need any caffeine, but grabbed a water and some snacks: mixed nuts and a granola bar, overpriced as expected. BF's sister grabbed a cappuccino, which I have to say tasted quite nice.

Employees were polite and prompt. Several outlets available for charging phones or computers, though you may have to hunt for them or wait for them to become free. There's also one by the creamer/napkin station if you simply can't wait and don't mind holding your phone as you scout for a table. Though most people will probably hate you for doing this.

Gotta ask for the bathroom key, which is annoying but understandable.
author: Stefany V.

description:
I come here every day.  Love the employees - fast, friendly, accommodating. 

But, I have a bone to pick with one person. 

Oftentimes, I order a looseleaf tea, which requires someone to spoon the tea into a bag so that the tea can steep without you later swallowing tea leaves. Part of that bag hangs out of the top of the cup for the same reason - to keep the leaves in the bag and out of your mouth. Now, everyone in every tea shop that I've ever been to knows that that top part of the bag needs to be tucked in somewhere (typically, between two cups) in order to prevent it from wicking hot water out of the cup and on to your hand...everyone but this one person at this Peet's. 

Don't get me wrong, I'm not opposed to self help, but the opportune time to tuck in the bag is before you put 20 ounces of scalding hot water in the cup.  It's not easy to do it after the fact....

Anyway, this is the most petty Yelp review I've ever written, but this shit is annoying.  Otherwise, I love this Peet's. Someone please just tell the dude about tucking in the bag.  

Piece.
author: Chris W.

description:
Coffee in a pinch!

Having just returned to the country the day before & w/ some major jetlag going on, I had planned to see an opera w/ Buddy #1 some time back before realizing what I was saying yes to....

Not being 1 to back on my commitments, I knew an energy boost was needed to survive the 3+ hrs.....enter Peet's

Peet's was especially appreciated as Philz was closed - props!

Within walking distance to the Opera House, line moved super-quickly & the coffee was the standard Peet's fare

House Drip - bold flavor, strong pour, no sugar required, way hot & totally hit the spot.  Thank you Peet's for coming through in a pinch & getting ME through the opera!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Pretty good Peet's. Friendly baristas. The line moves pretty quickly during the morning rush. Plenty of seating. And you can walk right into A Clean Well Lighted Place for er...Books Inc. Anyway, what I'm trying to say is, on the bookstore side there are a couple tables in there that are really chill. It's nice to be in a bookstore while you're getting your coffee on.
author: Ted R.

description: Who says the local businessman is dead?! Sure, Peet's (the brand) is a corporation, but a few visits to this Peet's location and you'll feel like you're a local. Been coming here for years, and the staff is always cordial, quick, and most remember your drink!! It's a very busy store, but the line moves quickly, they keep it well stocked, and the coffee is strong & tasty.
author: Katie V.

description: Poor customer service I haven't been here in about a year now I remember why. Normally if a shop gets your order wrong they apologize & offer to fix it but going through the trouble of sending a customer in circles printing out receipts rather than  offering to fix the mistake because they weren't listening the first time is too much. I'll be going back to Philz now thank you
author: Karen O.

description: My best friend and I come here almost every morning! Its a super convenient location that has great hours! We absolutely love the staff here! They are super friendly and accommodating with any special drink order you may have!
author: Lauren D.

description:
when I tried to order a tea cooler drink last week, I was shocked to find out they are out and won't be back.  I was actually mocked by their staff as they think its funny on their customer their tea cooler drink is out!

On top their on site supervisor basically blow me off and said talk to corporate.
hmm,   not coming back to Peet's.
author: Tkd K.

description:
Ok ok ok...I need to make it known that of the 100 times I've been here, only 1 has been crappy, thus the 3 stars.

I work one block away and my team and I frequent this Peet's location a minimum of 2-3 times per day.  We know many of the staff by name and love them! ie: John and the guy with the nail polish.

However, I stopped in this weekend to a surprisingly slow moment at the coffee shop and was hardly "helped" by a young man named Kyle whose attitude made me start to look around for a hidden camera.  I literally thought I was being punk'd, like three times.  

From his lack of acknowledgement to forgetfulness of a simple two drink order (I repeated my order one step at a time, 4 times and after handing him my money, he asked me how much I handed him after staring at it without counting it)...to rudeness, you'd think he was independently wealthy or something cause he sure wasn't about his job that day.

I've always look forward to popping in because of the friendly faces, helpfulness and good cup of coffee.  However, I now feel like I have to wear glasses and fake mustache and do a quick walk by to see if Kyle is there because I would hate to experience him again. Yes, I know...total first world problems.
author: Alex T.

description: It is Peets so the coffee is about what you'd expect. However, I got here at 7 and they claimed to be closed when the hours on the door clearly state that they're open until 8.
author: Matthew C.

description:
Today was my lucky day. After a long day and heading out of the city, looking for a good cup of coffee.  Dropped in to this store of of VanNes, and found the most friendly helpful staff/workers. This is a great place to stop before getting on the freeway on your way out. 
Thanks to all on the late afternoon shift.
author: Tom F.

description:
If I can start every work day with a large almond latter, extra hot from Peet's, I can probably triple my tolerance for elevator small talks and my productivity would surely fly over. 

This a great Peet's location. It's connected to the bookstore next door and inside a small plaza of shops and restaurants. The staff is super friendly and nice here. They're always happy to see you. There's about 6 small tables and countertop seating along the store front window. Also, there is a restroom. 

I love the ample amount of natural lighting in this coffee shop. Their coffee drinks are always on point. Peet's has better quality than Starbucks for sure! Too bad their prices are a bit higher, but hey, $5 is not too much to ask of you are getting productive-happy-feel-good-vibes in return. 

My drink of choice: Large almond latte, extra hot. Yup, I love my classic espresso drinks.
author: Ellen W.

description: Hey, I wasn't a coffee drinker,but since I tried the peet's one I'm. U can Easley smell the real coffee once u r close by. Service costumer excellent.
author: Mohamed B.

description:
This Peet's is always full of customers and is never too busy for you! The baristas are really cool...I've never felt so welcomed in a coffee shop. I've been a regular for almost two years and my experience every single time has been pleasant. They remember your name and always greet you if they aren't too busy. I personally think they're all quite fashionable as well!

The building is connected to a bookstore that is really nice and convenient as well. They're fast and I always leave with a smile on my face! Thanks guys you're number one!!!
author: Destin M.

description: I went to get a cup of coffee while I waited for a friend to get off from work. Coffee service was great overall. The only hiccup was a verbal altercation between two patrons. One was on a cell phone and the other berating him for doing so.  The manager aptly requested the patron to end his call but ended up later calling the police at the request of the woman who was berating the caller. The caller was handcuffed outside the establishment - I still do not know the reason. While the rest of us thought that the incident had ended, the berating patron - whom originally was making way more noise/commotion than the caller - continued to do so as she "spoke" (more shouted) to another patron about how right she was in asking Pete's employees to call the police and how much the caller deserved being taken to jail. She was making so much of a commotion that it prompted 2 other patrons and me to leave Pete's.  Only after our exit the employees asked the berating woman to stop being loud.  If it would have been me, she and not the caller should have left Pete's.
author: Francisco O.

description: I'm quite fond of this location. I used to live nearby and would come here several times per week. I'd recommend it if you're in the area. Heck of a lot better than the McDonald's across the street that's for sure!
author: Bryan R.

description:
I used to love this peets. Went there a few times a week and it was nice seeing the familiar faces there. Recently though there has been staff change and maybe half of the old staff is there regularly it seems. Since then, less organized and less friendly atmosphere. Also, there is an issue with the peets paper cups, which leaks when the cover is fully on. I actually have been observing this issue for a long time and know the worse is when the top opening of the lid is right over the seam. Basically the liquid inside leaks out of the seam. I used to just make sure I don't put the top there. But I've been noticing it leaks as I walk down the street even if I or the barista situate the lid right. This means the actual design of the cup us defective. I had wet hands and drips on jackets the last few weeks and is fed up. I tried to tell the"manager" lady, but you proceed to condescendingly tell me you see this seam? It leaks if you put the lid like this. Hello?! It's your barista who put it like this! Plus I already know the issue and was trying to point out this shouldn't be an expected default in your business. I don't walk down the street in a philz or Starbucks cup with this issue. Don't expect to have a to go cup that gives you wet hands. What is the point of having a coffee on the go when it is all over you by the time you catch the bus. 

I miss the old folks at peets and do not enjoy the new people poker faced and condescending tones. People just want a straight forward cup of no hassle coffee in the morning. Come on. You can't even deliver that with those two bucks and give people attitude. I've been long time customer for 3 years. Now I'm going to philz for my beans and my morning joe.
author: P L.

description:
My favourite Peet's Tea in SF simply for the fact that there are restrooms, loads of tables with seating, and connected to Books Inc!! 

I wish they would put a little bit more focus their Tea though, when inquiring, they took out a laminated menu of their Tea selections & it ought to be on the boards along with all of the Coffee drinks they advertised. 

But of course, Peet's has to be as American as possible and shine a Light on Coffee.

Their Saucers don't fit the Tea cups/mugs properly which is a bit of a nuisance as well, and I wish they had proper Tea service! 

But for the sake and likes of me being nice this evening I am going to give them 5 stars cos I did have a lovely experience in the shop today, as particular as I may be.
author: Julian I.

description: Been to this Pete's numerous times and they consistently have subpar service.  Just not what you would expect at a Pete's.  The coffee is always good - that is once you are able to get it.
author: Jonathan G.

description: I always stop in here for my afternoon coffee break, the baristas are so great here, always very friendly and nice to chat with.  Peet's Corporate should do something nice for the employees of this location, the employees really stand out as very hard working and are great to their customers.
author: Amy Y.

description:
Yesterday morning, my brother-in-law was falsely accused and publicly humiliated for stealing with the threat of bodily harm and, all the while, frightening his 4-year old son by a Peet's Coffee employee.  Another patron who witnessed this incident pointed out to the employee that it was a mistake and that my brother-in-law was innocent.  To make matters worse, this employee did not offer any apology.  A second employee was snickering the whole time and posturing like a bully when my brother-in-law asked for the employee's name.  I can't wait for the YouTube posting of this incident to be posted by other patrons who had their smartphones out that morning.  

I guess there's some sort of profiling in this particular establishment.
author: Ray S.

description: I love this place!!! I usually buy regular coffee, chai latte and ice coffee...They are very friendly....Hugs & Smiles!!!
author: Angela L.

description:
I visit here every Sunday and Monday.
Really wonder how often they change the barista and other employees. It used to so good. I meant coffee taste but last Sunday the lady made latte was awful . I throw away 'cause it taste like water..... Peets~! You should watch out your barista~!!!
They made my morning so bad.
Although the cashier was so friendly.
author: Winny L.

description:
My absolute favorite Peets  
They always get it right and with a smile!
author: Susy C.

description:
I have spoken to the manager about this before, but I guess the staff are not taking not.
Again I am sitting drinking my coffee and eating a pastry. One street lady came in with a dress that short you could see everything below and was allowed to use the bathroom and even a member of staff gave her a dollar. Another street guy came in and was not stopped picking the garbage cans for food and she stayed inside to eat what he had found and proceeded to clean his crusty feet full of scabs which totally put me off so I finished my purchase outside in the cold as was more pleasant.
author: Peter D.

description: Hubby says his coffee is burned (I concur). Great location though (near the Opera house)
author: Prescila B.

description:
I've been frequenting this Peet's off and on since the Books Inc. next door was A Clean Well-Lighted Place for Books, and have always been a Peetnik (until now).  Today I drove up from the Peninsula, specifically to get a coffee and bite from this Peet's on the way home to Oakland.

After making a purchase at Books Inc., approximately 20 minutes prior to close I go to Peet's and stand in line for the restroom prior to making a purchase.  After waiting several minutes behind another customer waiting for the restroom and noticing the door said "vacant" in spite of it being locked, I asked one of the staff if a key was needed to open it.  I was then told the restroom was closed for the evening since they were cleaning it, and it could not be used after it was "sanitized".  I asked what about the folks using it the next day, since that would be after it was "sanitized", and what would the difference be if I used it tonight?  I was told sorry, that I was not allowed to use it, despite practically having to piss my pants.  

When I worked in a restaurant, we did the cleaning AFTER close, so as not to inconvenience customers.  Apparently at this Peet's, watching the clock and punching out early is more important than customers.  Not only did I NOT then make a purchase and tip (as I ordinarily do), I won't ever be back.
author: Nathan F.

description:
This Peet's has what you want when you want it, however the staff does leave a lot to be desired. The snooty attitude of a few of them can mar an otherwise pleasant experience. I'd rather be at Philz across the street than spend my money here. Minus three stars for rude service at Peet's.

Two stars however for the good dessert/pastry selection, though why the food is out in the open and not covered at all is anyone's guess. Last week there were fruit flies crawling around the pastries in the open cabinet, with the staff coughing all over the open treats. Come on Peet's!! Cover your pastries and hire friendlier people!
author: Jen S.

description: God forbid you mess up and say grande or any other Starbucks term!!! And that's my tip for any Peet's in general! Respect!
author: Kitty O.

description:
I usually don't write up and rate a coffee chain...even a small one but really wanted to.  I found my last visit to Peets to be fantastic.  I love Peets and always miss Peets when I travel and there is no Peets.  

I stopped by as it was a convenient on the way to wine country and had to stop by to fuel up.  I like how many Peets do a tasting of the latest blend or pure play coffee--I have tasted most but I enjoy being re-reminded. Tasting through 3 coffees for sampling was a great way to start my morning.  I enjoyed the superb staff met the manager and while I think most Peets has a great staff--the staff on my last visit were so nice and into their craft --- well done!
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: Great place to grab a cup of coffee.  The staff is very friendly and their service is quick.  I am usually in and out with a good cup of coffee within three to five minutes!  It's also a great spot for some people-watching. You never know who you will run into there.  I have seen quite a few politicians and local celebrities getting coffee there!
author: Harvey K.

description: Chai Vanilla Iced Latte
author: Wynton F.

description: Not the worse, not the best Peet's I've been to. I noticed that the smell of coffee was extremely strong in here when I was there. I like the smell as much as anyone else, but only in moderation. I got a headache from the coffee aroma overload. I feel their coffee is alright, but compared to say Starbucks, I'd choose Starbucks only by comparing taste. The coffee here seems almost all black whenever I get coffee. Not like in Starbucks where it can be as mild as I choose, maybe I should start customizing my drinks here. The store itself is small, and it is connected to Books Inc. The bathroom can be on the dirty side because so many people use it.
author: Alex T.

description:
Yesterday was the second time I have been to this Peets location within a month and will probably my last.
I walked in needing to purchase some Mulled Spices and decided to buy a cookie and a double espresso with a "splash" of hot milk.
I paid the cashier, made a special request that I only want a small amount of milk because the last time I was at this Peets I received a half cup of hot milk, it's too much. 
The cashier told the barista my request, I moved over to wait for my drink. What was placed in front of me was a double espresso. I asked, "where's the hot milk?", he said I didn't pay for it and suggested I get some milk from the pitcher on the counter, sigh, REALLY? Yes, I could add cold milk to a double espresso but that would ruin it. This is the second time I can't get what I feel is a simple order made to order and I'm ready to ask for a refund and go to Philz up the street except that they don't make espresso.

The Barista calls me over, says he'll give me the hot milk and there won't be a charge and pours way too much milk in the cup and now my espresso is swimming in hot milk. I refused the order. For the price that I pay for a coffee drink I expect to get it made the way I asked for it.
He made another drink and this time only poured the amount I asked for, thank you, finally!
author: David P.

description: very good customer service. and a great place to eat pastry/bakery that has been a nest for gnats and other bugs all day.  seriously, their entire pastry section is always overloaded with bugs.  this is an easy fix!
author: Max S.

description:
Walking into the establishment it feels like a starbucks, no biggie, was just hoping for more of a local San Francisco feel since we're out-of-towners. 
I ordered 2 drinks and a scone. The guy at the counter doesn't make eye contact with me at all during the process, too busy staring at the screen, even while I asked him about the teas they have. He couldn't answer my question stating "I'm not much of a tea guy". My bad for assuming he would be helpful working for a "coffee & TEA" place. I go to pick up my order and realize one of the drinks was missing. I ask Daniel specifically about my missing drink and it he said someone else must have picked it up but they would make it again. I realize that they have made the same thing I had already picked up again. Both times he failed to listen to a me and when I complained to him he said he could go ahead and ring me up for the new drink. The drinks were okay, nothing amazing. The woman making the drinks was very helpful and helped correct the problem and apologizing for Daniel's actions. I thought rude barristas were a myth but I guess I was wrong.
author: Caroline R.

description:
So it's been 7 months since my last review of this location. This one is located downstairs from my work, so I'm happy that I have only one flight of stairs to take to go get my morning caffeine fix. Since my last review, there have been changes. New manager, several new faces, some of the staff have transferred to other locations, while some have made shift changes, and a couple have remained in the morning shift. Oh, I've noticed that's it's been busy a lot at the different times I've gone down there too. One thing that hasn't changed is their coffee (at least I haven't noticed) and their great service. They all work hard and I know how a challenge it is to work in customer service. I work in a busy clinic, so I know about long lines and having to provide great service, while multi-tasking and trying not stress-out at the same time in a fast-paced, and sometimes hectic environment.

Although I was surprised to find out that day in Sept. that it was Tommy's last day at this location =(, or to find out that Jen's last day was sometime last month =( and was going to be working at the Fillmore location, I am slowly getting used to the newbies and slowly, very slowy, learning their names. Yes, I got used to seeing the same faces during the morning shift ( amongst them was Jen, Damien, Darryl, Brandon), but at least I still get to see some familiar faces =) : Bee, Carrie, Jana, Peter, and Noelle (sp?). BTW,  a big thanks goes out to Noelle for catching that slight error the other day. I guess I should start paying attention when I put in my order. Thank you for still being a great morning crew and always remembering my drink (and name) and keeping me well caffeinated, otherwise I'd be growling at my co-workers in the morning....grrrr....=).  Oh, love that they have petite chocolate scones too. Don't have to feel too guilty for having a little guilty pleasure =). 

Oh, so this review is also a shout out to the quality of Peet's coffee. I don't know, but I've somehow become addicted to Peet's coffee since discovering it five years ago. I never drank coffee until I went back to school at night years ago, so now I just need it to get through the day and Peet's coffee is my go to coffee.
author: Neni E.

description: I walked in and was immediately impressed with the staff. So friendly and professional. However, the I wasn't very happy with my drinks. The coffee was so-so and my mothers blended drink was sickeningly sweet. I know those things are supposed to be sweet but this was a little overwhelming. Maybe it was just an off day but I would give it a second chance.
author: Laura B.

description: Coffee is not great, but cheap. The killer was the lack of wifi when I stopped by. Kind of wish I knew before I had ordered.
author: Ceasar B.

description: I don't really like coffee shops too much or Peet's Coffee and Tea because it's too much like Starsucks and there's too much of a corporate feel.
author: Denise C.

description:
Peet's #7...A Clean Well-Lighted Place for Coffee.  

Yes, this Peet's is connected to the Books Inc that occupies the former site of the legendary bookstore.  Of course, Books Inc has lots of locations, so I'm not sure what business would ordinarily take me to this rather uninspiring stretch of Van Ness (this morning I had some time to kill before the City Hall tour).  Perhaps a pre-show drink if you're going to the Opera Plaza Cinema?  Or after an architectural tour of the orange-tastic, 80's revival McDonalds across the street?

And call me crazy, but the latte I got here just didn't seem up to par with Peet's, so I gotta dock it a star.
author: Wes M.

description: Matcha latte baby! I'm cutting down on coffee, but if you asked me about their hot choc, it's okay, I've had better. But their matcha latte is something I'd keep coming back for.
author: May G.

description:
I love Peets. I always get exactly what I wanted. My usual is a small decaf hazelnut soy latte, flat (no foam). It's always the right temperature. Never not hot enough like at other coffee shops (i.e. Starbucks) and always consistent with their drinks. Thank you Peets!!!

What's also great about this one also is that they're right next to a bookstore. No need to even walk out of Peets to go into the store, just walk right through!
author: Heidi L.

description: This is my favorite coffee shop that I frequent all the time. The delicious smell of freshly roasted coffee and clean comfortable environment keep me coming back every chance I get! The baristas here are very friendly and knowledgeable about the freshest roasts or promotions Peet's currently offers. I will usually come in and purchase a $25 gift card and enjoy my free medium drink while chatting with friends or getting some reading done. On subsequent visits, I'll use that same gift card to buy some Sumatra or Arabian Mocha Java coffee beans, ground for the French Press. I especially enjoy very strong, full-bodied, and smooth coffees. What a perfect coincidence that all of Peet's coffees are pure arabica beans with their well-known strong, dark roast. It's become a daily ritual of mine to start my mornings with a pastry and French Press coffee. Purchasing coffee beans here nets you a free small cup of their delicious freshly brewed coffee (or you can opt for a coupon to redeem on your next visit). I usually keep it simple here with a soy latte. Mmm so creamy and smooth! Costs for high-grade green, unroasted beans have been steadily increasing the past couple of years. I remember Sumatra used to be $12.95/lb a few short years ago, but now costs $14.95/lb. That doesn't deter me one bit though since it's still cheaper to brew my own. Finally, they have free Wi-Fi here! All in all, I'm a loyal "Peetnik" eager to return every couple of weeks for my Peet's fix!
author: Andy C.

description:
Great for coffee & awesome vibe. Better chai please!

I love this place for coffee, however I'm a big chai fan. I would LOVE to see a real chai served at a coffee place --meaning the actual spiced tea with milk, not a syrup addition to black tea. 

If Petes could do this they would have even more of an edge over Starsux! I'm already a huge fan, but  this would take it to the next level.
author: Michelle S.

description: from the hundreds time i've been here i never got treated like today. sadly i dont remember the name of the guy who worked the register. he mumbled, i didnt understand him so i asked to repeat he just rolled his eyes at me in a very rude way and was not willing to be helpful. i was so close to ask for the mananger. in the end i got something i didnt even order. this young guy really needs to change his attitude or needs to replaced. apart from that i nearly always had a delightful experience.
author: Chris V.

description:
My best drink there is the Chai Soymilk Latte.  The taste is heavenly and the foam add a nice fun kick.  I love the abundant seating.  I also enjoy that there is a hall way that takes you right into Books Inc. to browse afterward.  

The place is clean and the bathrooms are large and clean as well.

Great location, lots of sunny all glass windows.
author: Vanilla C.

description: I wandered in here from Books Inc. The dude on register was pretty nice. The dude who made my drink was coughing up a storm and didn't say anything when I said thanks. I think his coughing bothered me more. If you're sick, maybe stay home?  On the up side, maple lattes have returned!
author: k h.

description:
I pass by this Peet's on my morning stroll to work. This place is in a good area - right at the corner. I can walk by and see if there's a line. If there isn't I walk in and order my drink. The staff is really friendly and make my drink with my customization. I've been coming in on Fridays in the month of July because they have the $2 Medium Freddo Fridays. You can customize however you like - with syrups, whip cream on top, coffee/tea. 

They do tastings in the store and the next one should be first week of August from 1-2pm. People who participate get 15% off the coffees being tasted that session. They also feature teas/ice teas also. 

There are plenty of seats and tables for people to sit and relax for a bit. There is a bookstore right next store, Bank of America ATM a few doors down, and a Walgreens up the next block. This is a convenient location - right at the corner of the block.
author: Candace F.

description: Really enjoyed the coupon but prefer a local coffee shop to a chain.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Great coffee shop in the opera/city hall/federal courthouse area.

The caramel rice krispy treats are awesome.  I am not aware of them being sold anywhere else.  Worth an extra two or three blocks out of your way, especially if you are looking for gluten free.

The bookstore next door is almost always happening.  Often there are good speakers/authors giving a presentation.

I look forward to my next visit.  Friendly service, and it is clear that the staff care about the coffee and the customers.

Been here at least 20 times, so my experiences have been four stars overall.
author: Mark G.

description:
At my old job, there was a Starbucks right downstairs from me.  So when I moved to a new job in a new location, I was totally bummed out that there was no Starbucks nearby.  I kept saying how much I missed my old work location because there was so much stuff near there.  My sister finally had it with me and told me to try the Peet's at the Opera House.  She is a huge fan so I thought what the hell, I'll give it a whirl.  

It's been a month and I can't imagine life with out Peet's.  I also feel a little spoiled because this Peet's is great.  It's pretty busy here and you would think that you are gonna wait a long time but I get my drink in a timely manner.  Plus, the people that work at this location are extremely nice and even remember my name and order.  I know this isn't a unique thing that only happens at Peet's but since I have only been going there regularly for a month, it means a lot to me.  My drink is always good and I am always satisfied with my orders.  

I am officially addicted to Peet's and I have the Peet's at the Opera House to thank for this!!!
author: Gabriela R.

description: The line was out the door with a bunch of business people at nearly ten, who likely went to work and left for their coffee break so that was annoying. The people at Peet's  turned it around since the line moved efficiently and they were friendly, albiet busy. I got an iced coffee since I was dying in a silk Chloe blouse (it was baking outside that morning). I also got the apricot scone, which must have been laced with exlax. That's why I am giving it 3 stars.
author: Jessica f.

description:
Coffee = good
Coffee + books = excellent
Peet's Coffee + books = happy Patty

I came in to buy a pound of coffee, got a complementary cup of joe, loaded $20 on my Peet's card, got a $1 off the pound of coffee.  What a lovely afternoon.
author: Patty W.

description: I love this peets!!!!  They have the best and coolest workers!  They greet you by your name everytime you enter the store and everyone is super friendly!  I always order a latte and they know EXACTLY how I like it!  I come here almost 4 times a week!
author: Melissa T.

description: One of the fastest Peets in the city. Churns out your brew with a snap and alacrity. The cute redhead barista makes the best drinks. The brew coffee is varied and offers more roast optuons than most chain coffee shops. Great tea selection also. Peets skirts that corporate behemoth and mom/pop shop line pretty well. Do lose your way as you grow Peets. Don't become Starbucks.
author: Quentin J.

description:
I've always gotten great lattes at this Peet's except for once, and they did give me a refund that time (it was a lack of foam in an extra-foamy latte, as is usually my only reason for refusing drinks other than a mix up in the actual order).

Every other time has been consistently good. The staff is a bit snobbier than my other regular location on Mission (indie geeks who are too good for you types) but they make good coffee so I'll get my little rays of sunshine elsewhere.

I love the nutmeg you can grind yourself (this is a feature at all Peet's).
author: Love X.

description: Having seen the bookstore adjacent to the cafe, I went in to look for some reference materials, and ended up ordering a cup of really black coffee and staying a while.  It is nice to know there is a cafe chain with a presence in the city besides the top - ranked one that many people go to as well.  My finding this place was unlikely, and it is really a little gem of a location and the fare and service are (standard) of apparently excellent quality as well.  Great; really nice.
author: Thomas H S.

description:
The staff here are so friendly, and the fact that it's right on Van Ness is so convenient, making it my go-to for the past year or so. 

Every morning after hopping off the bus, I would see all the fellow 9-5'ers around the Civic Center area picking up their morning cup. Very popular place for us in the area since there isn't many coffee places, besides Blue Bottle and Starbucks at Fox Plaza.

BUT WATCHOUT NOW- Philz has moved across the street, and since then, I have not stepped back (not even once) into this sentimental Peet's location.

And I'm afraid I won't be back.
author: Theresa B.

description: I have one compliant about this place!!  They carry Devil's Food Cupcakes, but sporadically.  They get me addicted to them and then they do not order them all the time.  I am an everyday customer for the cupcakes.!!!  Please start ordering them again.
author: T.J. L.

description:
Let's skip the history lesson about the Starbucks' founder and the Peet's guy, and focus on the coffee.

Peet's continues to make one of the best chain cups of coffee--remarkable consistency between locations is evident!

This particular location has good, strong coffee, with that unmistakable Peet's strength and bitter tang.  This one shares a doorway with Books, Inc, so you can pick up a local author (look for the LitQuake! participants!) and head over to Peet's for a tasty cup.

Staff here turns over slowly, so even if you're only in once a week or so, as I am, you'll still get to "Know Your Barrista."  One of the best iterations of the Peet's model.
author: Martin W.

description:
I strolled in to buy a box of tea bags and left with four canisters of different loose leaf teas. Originally I intended to spend less than $10, but I ended up spending almost $50... thanks to this helpful little barrista girl, or maybe she was a manager, who helped me understand all the different types of teas they carry at Peet's. 

She asked me all the right questions and was super knowledgeable about all the teas they have... explaining to me the difference between the tea bags, loose leaf teas, and premium teas. She also took out samples so I could smell the leaves and experience them for myself. She was also very patient with my notorious indecisiveness. I wish I could remember that girl's name... definitely a great employee and has excellent customer service skills. If I owned a coffee/tea shop I'd be trying to poach her to work at my store. 

When I get through my stash of teas, I'll be back at Peet's looking for more.
author: Maria L.

description: I love Peet's. This location is near my gym, so I pretty much go there every day before working out for rocket fuel. Employees are courteous, helpful and make a good iced Americano. It's everything a Peet's should be.
author: Jeff R.

description:
OMG you guys.  I AM SO HIGH.

It's like how's the ground down there and shit...
author: Rachel G.

description: When I'm not running late for work, I usually go to this Peets spot, because I love Peets and it is near the parking garage and the work place.  I've been to many Peets, and this one is by far the best one! The people who work here are very friendly, courteous, and speedy, which helps out tremendously when I am running late.  Oh, and the coffee is awesome! :)
author: Chela R.

description:
When times are tough, the sky gray, and the world is lonely--sometimes I just need Jesus.   

Until his return I turn to Peet's. 

----------------
The people here do not have attitude and do not pretend to be Coffee artisans.  Just put it in lotion form and rub it on my belly please...use both hands.
author: Bill B.

description:
Coffee has a burnt taste
Large selection of pastries (even vegan)
Staff is friendly
Two star rating due to coffee...
author: Raymond F.

description:
Peets rubs your nose in it from the wonderful aroma when you walk in the door.

So here's a few things that AREN'T better than Starbucks.  No wifi free or otherwise except a trickle from the shopping mall upstairs.  Layout and decor are decent but not great.  No comfy lounge chairs.   Extremely smoky brew is not to everone's taste.  And bombastic classical music first thing in the morning is even worse than the $#*$% Starbucks plays.

Design oopsies from the poorly conceived Opera Plaza building.  For example, a roll up door along one wall and a row of nasty dirty skylights with a view of the concrete underside of the building a few feet above.  It's hard to believe they used to throw up a looming  prison block of an urban renewal project and call it architecture.
author: Gil S.

description:
So last night was terrible. One of those nights where you cry your damned eyes out and wake up with a swollen, puffy mess of a face. 

(i was robbed... wah-wah)

(then goods were recovered. yay! yay!! 
...thankfully, or else i would have no medium to write this review)

ANYWAYS... Peet's.

When I woke up this morning, it was a definite caffeine emergency. After all the adrenaline from the night before, I felt hung over. Sluggish. Depleted.

Of course, the only cure for what ails you when in this sort of situation is a good, strong (but not bitter) cup of joe. The sort of cup I needed was only available at one place: Peet's.

I walked in and was immediately greeted by the friendly and soothing smell of freshly-brewed coffee. The place had a nice people-meet-espresso machine buzz going. Fortunately, the line was relatively short (it can be hellish during the mid-morning rush), the cashier friendly, and my much needed comfy latte was ordered and made (perfectly frothed) within minutes.  Once raw-sugared, I took a sip. *ahhh* I felt that I was on my way back to normal.  The world felt like it had been put back to it's proper place. Life was once again "Good" and my faith in humanity restored.

Deep sigh of relief in a cup, I tell ya.

Now if I could do something about these bags under my eyes, I'd be set.
author: Tiffinie T.

description:
Compared to my horrible experience with the Peet's on Geary and their very unhappy unpersonable employees, this place was fantastic.

I work at Peet's, so I perhaps hold fellow stores to higher standards than the next person--and this place met my needs.  They were a bit busy, and the girl at the register we ordered from wasn't incredibly friendly, but she wasn't rude either.  

My latte macchiato was perfect, though I don't believe it was actually called out--just sort of haphazardly set on the counter, so I didn't immediately retrieve it and the barista seemed a bit testy about that.

But the thing that really added that extra star to my experience was this awesome dude behind the counter who had a 10-minute conversation with my boyfriend about his Dead Kennedy's sweatshirt, and giving him the heads up about a Jello Biafra show coming soon.  I just adore friendly people.
author: Chelsea S.

description:
This isn't just a review on this particular Peet's, but for all the Peet's in the world! After I had my first Mocah Freddo here (Peet's version of Starbuck's Frappachino but 10x better), I never returned to Starbuck's again for my coffee needs. Whenever I know that there's a Peet's in the area, I'll go out of my way to put it in my schedule. 

Once I ordered a medium Mocha Freddo with extra whip cream, and they put it in a large cup for me so that they could pile on the sugary goodness! And it was about half Freddo, half whip cream by the time they were done with it! I was in HEAVEN. But those days are gone when I could consume drinks like that...now I will only allow myself guilty pleasures every once in a while. 

I wished there were more Peet's locations where I live...I'm surrounded by Starbuck's sadly.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
While I still have to admit that I miss Firenze, the tiny little cafe with the questionable cup o' joe that used to occupy this little corner of Opera Plaza where you could sit outside with your paper and smoke a cigarette, I'm just pleased as freakin punch this place moved in.  They took a little bit of property from the bookstore (used to be A Clean Well Lighted Place for Books, but it's now Books, Inc.), and it's a lot bigger, cozier, and nicer.  The staff are a very friendly bunch, and every now and then they take my Polaroid and proclaim me "Customer of the Week!"  That's worth 5 stars right there.  

It's about time I lived next door to a nice Peet's.  About damn time, yessir!
author: Thomas B.

description: Most of time stuff are very nice and helpful.    But only the elder woman, I didn't ask her name but she  has very short hair with partial high light on the front made me feel very embarrassing and made me feel never come back again.   I ordered medium green tee latte was almost $5.  I got my order and it was very light weight, because actual green tea was only 2/3 of the cup, rest was 1/3 foam.  I asked that short hair elder woman, if she could pour more green tea in my cup.  She wasn't helpful at all, was very rude to me.  She said loud, " what do you want!!!?" and I explained her nicely again, and she shouted at another woman " she wants more milk!!!!"  I felt embarrassing.  And I do not know why she did that to me, I was not unreasonable was very nice and polite.
author: Tori S.

description:
I LOVE this Peet's. And I don't even drink coffee!

Best chai I've had. Not too sweet (hate overly sugared chai), and the flavor was definitely prominent without being too much. Recently tried the pumpkin spiced latte (only for the pumpkin part, and decaf), and it was better than the watered-down version at Starbucks.

Great location, close to my work. It was a very nice complement to A Clean Well Lighted Place for Books next door, which is now a Books, Inc. But no matter, it's still a local bookstore!

I like their pastries too. The banana bread's good, and I think I've tried some scones before and they were good.

But be prepared to wait in line-it's always crowded in the mornings.
author: Linda L.

description: Just got the seasonal Pumpkin spice latte. Not bad but I'd prefer to have the option of a sugar-free syrup. Definitely tasted like pumpkin which was great b/c that's why I bought it! Seasonal latte for $3.45.
author: Marissa H.

description:
I am the biggest sucker in the world for caffeine. It is one of my nearest and dearest. In case you were unaware of this, Peet's has the most milligrams of caffeine in their coffee per serving.

The staff here is cordial if not down right friendly/ entertaining. Due to its proximity to lots of places on Van Ness (the movie theater, City Hall, Hastings Law School, next door to Books Inc) and free wifi, its a great place to park it and people watch, read, work on the computer, etc. if you like a healthy amount of activity around you. If you're just grabbing something to go, this place does move at a fast pace and if you are a person who likes to smoke and drink your coffee at the same time take a short jaunt into the center of The Opera Plaza atrium. There are a number of benches with ashtrays next to them in  pretty surroundings.
author: Veronica G.

description: grabbed a taxi when feet were still tired after 3rd peets walk for hot chocolate and hot chocolate here i requested without whip cream and this 4th cup of chocolate was as yummy as previous three cups!
author: Sin D.

description:
Working in the civic center wouldn't be the same without a Peet's around the area, especialy near CPUC building (the big state seal spot)

Allow me to paint the perfect experience going to this place.  
On a chilly typical SF morning, I get off the 47 Van Ness on Ellis and walk southwards.  It's 8:00am with the sun slowly showing through the disintegrating clouds.  As i breath out, you can see smoke as it quickly fades away.  Waiting for the light to cross, I rub my hands together to bring heat and warmth.  Then as I cross, I can smell the distant aroma of fresh brewed coffee.  As I walk in, I can hear the espresso machine going at it and the rich sweet smell of roasted coffee beans.  and as i order my cafe latte, i wait anxiously to taste that semi bitter, but vibrant flavor of coffee.  and after my name gets called, i grab that drink blow slowly at the top and then sip it ever so carefully so as to not burn my tongue.  mmm.  Peet's Coffee
author: Vincent K.

description: Gold stars for the guy who served me who was so calm and polite, cheerful and friendly in the middle of a storm. I dropped in to this Peets in the middle of the morning commute - the place was perfectly solid with grumpy people who were probably all late for work.  Like half of the adult population, I worked at a coffee shop in my early twenties, and I still remember what a disaster I became under the pressure of irritated sleepy people. Good job, barista guy, thank you for helping me keep my morning good.
author: A S.

description:
"Here, try this blueberry-hinted java we're sampling," he said to me.  "Taste the blueberry?"  

"Yeah," I said, "Definitely taste the blueberry."  

I tipped him 50 cents, after me and my girlfriend got our drinks.

Cute little Peet's.  Hit 'em up for double espresso before seeing a film at the Landmark.  They were a bit understaffed last night, according to the dude behind the counter.  

I like Peet's.
author: Abendigo R.

description: Come here for good coffee and friendly service. The prices are quite steep but if you want some quality coffee it is worth it. I don't know how Peet's does it but all of its employees are always smiling and ready to help.  I usually order a small coffee in a medium cup so that I can add milk to my coffee without wasting any of the good stuff. I have on occasion ordered a late and those are great too.
author: Dmitry G.

description: I have visited this Peets numerous times whenever I'm in the area on business.  Good mixture of peeps.  There is this super-caffeinated buzz in the atmosphere.  It's a nice feel.  I usually leave this cafe super-charged.  And they have a nice friendly staff.
author: Derek N.

description: Needed to pass some time before going to the Asian Musuem for their $5 Thursday night admission.  Was glad to find a Peet's, rather than the over-rated Starbucks.  Ordered a caramel espresso . . . so that's what it's supposed to taste like!  The mild hint of caramel and foamy milk on top complimented, not overshadowed the coffee.  I finally realized that the caramel macchiatos that I had been drinking from Starbucks were actually a caramel sundae from McDonald's with coffee in it.
author: Janet S.

description: Stop by for a quick caffine fix and the staffs are fast and quick...got my large coffee and back on the road again.
author: Za Shi T.

description: Go to spot when I need to get out of the office and get my daily dessert. The staff is great always nice and cheery. I also get my beans here and they've only run out of mocha java once, but gave a great alt recommendation.
author: Trang P.

description:
I am a self proclaimed Peets girl so obviously I'll keep coming back.  This is the Peets I go to in the morning if I am walking to work and need a pick up.  The line is always atriously long but they are efficient and friendly there.  There are a couple people who have been a bit surly but not necessarily to me so I'm going to write it off as "I need to get through the morning rush" stress.  I used to bartend on Friday nights so I know how it is.  Just trying to stay efficient.  

It still has the coziness of a Peets even though it is in one of the most concrete buildings I've ever seen.  And that I think is a feat.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Love this place. Saved me so many times from passing out at work. Also, having this place only about a 3 minute walk away from my building where I work just makes it all the more better. Having it attached to a book store just further pushes it up on my list of places to go for a quick break. 

Only downside, lines can get quite long. Hence why i usually go around 10am, but then again there's no wrong time for some Peet's.

One medium coffee please... I drink coffee. No fancy espresso's or cappuccino's for me.
author: Jay V.

description:
This particular Peet's signified my crossover...Starbucks be gone!

I don't know what it is....could it be the soy milk? could it be their espresso? could it be the care and compassion they take into making my drink?

I have no idea

But everytime I get a coffee here its THICK and CREAMY and DELICIOUS and, even after years of coffee consumption, still sometimes can manage to give me the coffee buzz.

OH? And the customer service? One time their espresso machine was acting up so it took an unusually long time to make the drinks....what did they do for our extra 5-10 min wait? GAVE US FREE COFFEE COUPONS!

RIGHT ON PEET'S!
author: Stacy L.

description:
i love this peet's! i never visit it enough, but I think I will on break time.  I have to say that they have the best blueberry muffins and the best tasting ice chai latte. 

Thanks Peet's for making my afternoon more enjoyable!
author: Jocelyn W.

description:
Thank you Peet's for being around the block from the courthouse. I had an hour and a half lunch break for jury duty, and after my brief lunch (see review of Sushi Hanna) I came here to read and sip on some coffee. 

The staff is super friendly. Best of all, the coffee shop connects with a bookstore, which made for a really enjoyable break!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Starbucks I am done with you for now, you have messed up too many of my orders...i will miss you...

Peet's, is consistent, service is pleasant and they make excellent creamy foam, well worth the walk from work. I just wish they had cozy couches and atmosphere similar to Starbucks...still I give them 5 stars. 

I have tried several locations and so far this Peet's is excellent.
author: Dee D.

description:
I come here practically every morning before work. 

And this is the best coffee shop I've ever been to bar-none. I love the white chocolate mocha, or the caramel latte. Tasty, and they know how to make it right. The only problem is that this Peets constantly gets people coming and going during the early buisness morning rush and lunch times. But it's definitely worth the wait, when you really want good coffee. The employees are definitely attentive and cater to your needs, and do so with a smile on their faces. I can't think of another place where you know everyone working there is happy. 

Oh, and the espresso is deadly. Shot to the brain. Seriously.
author: Clinton L.

description:
OK.

What you need to know is that I'm on a matcha kick, so this may be a little biased.  Am usually late to the trendy stuff, so I just discovered the awesomeness that is matcha, and can't get enough of it.

How is it so green?

How is it so yummy?

Matcha should be in all things!

Peet's has a nice matcha "smoothie," if you will.  Not too sweet, blended with ice and a little milk.  If you like, a little whipped cream on top makes it a little sweeter and creamier.  

Excellent.

Now, if only I'd realize that matcha + me = inability to sleep at night.  

Oh well... it's worth it!
author: Linda C.

description: Brilliant little coffe place.  Friendly servers, and just the right level of sweetness and sweetness for a mocha IMO.
author: Kevin V.

description: Same great coffee & tea as other Peet's stores; friendly staff. Kudos to this branch for being a couple blocks down from the Cathedral Hill Hotel, with their cheap-ass teas and ridiculously-priced internet access.
author: Ramon E.

description: No fair! This Peet's comes with a bookstore! If I lived near this Peet's, my friends would never see me anymore.
author: Zulu Q.

description:
People who know me know that I love me some Peet's, and granted this isn't my favorite Peet's to go to, it's the one I go to everyday because it's on the way to school. (By the way, favorite Peet's is the one in Menlo Park - they have the best foam.  It's nice and frothy!)

The coffee and espresso here is always a great start to my day, and for a little icy afternoon sugar, the swirl is the way to go.  Goodies from the case are all of their cake loaves (e.g. marble, pumpkin cheesecake, banana bread and cherry), and I'm not a huge scone and muffin person but they always look good and the ones that I've had are pretty good.
author: Karen L.

description:
I go to this location 5x a week for my morning soy latte on the way to work. The staff here is absolutely fantastic. Sometimes when they see me in line and aren't making an espresso drink, they'll make it and it's ready when I pay...what service. They are always so friendly and fun here, I like them a lot.

I also go to the Broderick/Oak St and the Castro locations on the weekends. They too are great.

What's better than Peets coffee?  It's ROCKS!
author: John S.

description:
I love Peet's.  I've really never been a big coffee drinker, but recently I've needed to stay caffeinated in order to get some work done....long story short, I've been frequenting Peet's on Van Ness on a regular basis.  

The staff at this store are awesome!  They are  super friendly and always have a smile and a warm greeting for me.  They are experts Barista's and I can count on an excellent cup of coffee every time.  I was once inclined to think all chain coffee was the same from store to store.  I'll just say at some locations, the same Caffe Mocha tastes totally different...not in a good way.

I love the fact I can get online for free for two hours.  The store is very clean.  I love the atmosphere.  Its a truly pleasurable experience.
author: Luke B.

description: One of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had.  Surly, rude people work here.
author: Jim E.

description: I love peets coffee and the wait proves that everyon else does too!
author: Katherine s.

description: Our go to place for coffee. Convenient location, good service and great coffee.
author: Gigi L.

description: Great staff.  Amazing coffee.  But weird building; people have described it as cozy...umm concrete ain't cozy.
author: Tim G.

description: Peets rocks and the staff is really friendly, fast and knowledgeable.
author: Adam R.

description: I am foolish enough to think I have just made a new best friend whenever I get good customer service. Therefore, the chick in there yesterday is so my new BFF. I was all "I need coffee beans and I am going to be difficult and not know what I want." And she was like "You will love Major Dickinson's" and I was like, ok. When the new BFF offered me a cup of coffee on the house, I swooned hard for her. I would have asked her out but I am alledgedly straight.
author: Shannon V.

description: As far as Peet's is concerned this one isn't one of the best. I've got a drink here at least 5 times to give it a proper try out. Each time the drink came out wrong and very late. Although yes the customer service was good and polite and said "sorry" about the drink mistake, it still makes things suck when you have to wait longer and your drink sucked. Always busy! Yea it's busy that's good for business but for a customer who wants to chill, that sucks, people always saying excuse me. One of the times had a coffee silt on me . . .
author: Robert C.

description: Everybody should be lucky enough to have a Peet's within 2 blocks of their office.  Don't listen to the crap about the "bad neighborhood" and the crackheads--anybody who spends 5 minutes in Civic Center can appreciate the wide sidewalk in front, and can dodge/divert/ditch the occasional menace.  The government employees from the state and feds clog the joint all day long, but they are docile and mean you no harm.  Don't make eye contact with them and you will be fine.
author: Rusty M.

description:
every morning i walk by Peets and its wayyyy too over crowded..im not too big of a fan for their expresso drinks...there is a different taste to it..not because it's strong..just something about it...

the only time i come here is when i receive gift cards (i still have 3 in my wallet believe it or not) or if i am supppppppppppper sleepy and need an extra kick in my morning coffee....
author: M W.

description: This is a new Peet's Coffee and Tea Store that opened about 2 months ago at this location. My biggest complaint is the service is very slow. They have some very nice people working there but come on it shouldn't take 5 minutes to get a brewed coffee. The store carries everything you would find at any other Peet's.
author: Teddy d.

description: Five stars cuz my girlfriend works there, but I love this Peet's. Yeah the neighborhood is a bit sketch but hey that's the civic center area for ya.  I've grown up on Starbucks so took me a while to adjust to the strength of their coffee, but after the initial shock I must say I'll never go back.
