They may not have frappucinos but the make a mean mocha.  They work hard to protect their customers from the crack heads outside and I've seen them go above and beyond for that unruly customer. Love that Book's Inc. is right next door and I love to peruse the books whilst I wait for my girl to get off work.  Stop by and say hi, they're the nicest bunch around. Wouldn't suggest driving there tho, many a car have suffered from broken windshields etc...from the desperate crack head around the car, take MUNI or walk.
author: Marie B.

description: Thank goodness there is finally a Peets in the Civic Center area. What's fabulous about this one is its open at 5:30am.  Sweet!
author: James Y.

description: NOT my first choice for Peet's, as the crowd is a little sketchy around here. Not Peet's fault, but still...
author: Johnny O.

description: The coffee and espresso drinks are usually great, although sometimes they can be a little off.  The teas and pastries available are decent, though nothing special.  Service is usually pretty fast.  Many of the employees have been working there since I started coming here over a year ago, so they know their shit and I assume that they are being treated pretty well by the business.  It's also cool that the coffeeshop is connected (not merely adjacent) to the bookstore next door.
author: Joseph N.

description: Good weekend spot with the bookstore right there. You can grab some magazines, papers, books and then pop into Peet's for some coffee and quiet reading.
author: Lily K.

description: Hooray a Peet's in the area - another option for your AM or PM coffee fix.  I am actually not the biggest fan of Peet's coffee, I think it is too strong -- however, I think of the chain coffee stores they have the best pastry selection, especially their low-fat, low-cal stuff.  The low-fat banana blueberry muffin, scrumptious!
author: Katie P.

description: I love Peet's don't get me wrong, but the guy suggested the Jasmine Green Tea, and it sucked, and on top of that homeless people were walking in begging for money and/or food.  it was awkward.  not a lot of seating either!
author: Lindsay T.

description:
UPDATE:   I drop by daily for my morning fix.  The service appears to have improved slightly, meaning one doesn't have to wait as long through the line for good service.

Great coffee here, just like all the others.  My first time at this location, 8am in the morning on Tuesday of Thanksgiving week and there must have been 20 people in line.   Only one person was at the order counter...it wasn't until the line went out the door that two more order takers opened up.  Maybe this is a new Peets - I am sure that they will be more efficient and attentive soon - just like the others.  Though the line was long,  service (and coffee) were excellent.
author: Antonio E.

description: After attending the Rhone Rangers wine tasting on Sunday and then Zeitgeist that evening, I awoke on a couch on Gough Street at around 5:30 the next morning.  I was craving a black iced coffee from Peet's and hit this place on the way north.  The weary dawn that was coated in a pointless darkness started to crack at the seams as if the morning was uncertain about the coming day.  I sipped from the cup of pitch-blackness and headed yet further north.  I met with Stan, the guy that sells sofa beds.  He saw my inky black liquid and thought immediately that he must have the same.  So, we headed back to Peets to get another caffeinated mental smog eraser.  I was starting to feel better, but wanted badly to scurry home and hide in my bed while reality fornicated loudly on the other side of my dusty curtains.  Instead, I was out here to face it all.  But at least this Peet's iced black coffee was clearing away the dreariness of the day-to-day hustle, if only for a little bit of a little while.
author: Kenny R.

description: This peets is conveniently located across the street from me. The staff is very friendly, and most of them know my "usual," which is always nice.  The service can be a little slow at times, but thats understandable when there is a line to the door. But overall, i love this place. Its usually my first stop out the door.
author: Art V.

description: best iced chocolate milk ever!
author: Yadira G.

description: more then the coffee, the people who work here (the morning shift anyway) rock my world! the are the true believers of coffee...they take grumpy, angry, uncaffinated people like myself, serve them with a smile, and send them out into the world as functioning human beings ready to contribute to the world. especially the guy with the mohawk...you are the best!
author: Megan C.

description: Man I like how this shop is run fast efficient and clean . The manager gets it done and get it done right the first time no bs here . Not to mention nice and good looking. Ck it out.
author: Yuuhi S.

description: I enjoy peets coffee no matter what. I enjoy the staff that delivers great service. My last visit on this particular location I brought my dog in to order, the young lady behind the register asked right away if my dog was a service dog, I said no and thought they must not allow pets in the shop so I right away commented that ill leave right when I pay and pick up the drink when its ready. She said ok with a smile, while I took my cash out another lady said with a slight attitude that I needed to take him out now, I said ok let me just pay first, she said no now. I can understand the policies that people have to follow, but first things first is the proper customer service. I care dearly for my dog and I don't just tie him outside and leave him where all the dope heads hang out. The problem I had was the approach, a different way to say and deliver the message then just taking him out now? No matter what, I am the customer you are the associate, its my day off and its your paying shift. I was disappointed but not upset, ill just never go to this location again. I waited outside with my dog and maybe thought that the barista would just walk out and give me my drink, 5 minutes later nothing came out. I waited another 2 minutes and was sure that my drink was done. How can I get my drink inside if I can't bring my dog? Luckily a nice couple that walked by with the same dog I have greeted me and my pet. They tied their dog to the tree and were about walk in the shop. I asked if they would get my drink while I wait here with the dogs, they said yes ofcourse! The gentlemen walked out with my drink and asked if I needed anything in the coffee, I said thank you no, this is perfect.
author: Jireh S.
